subject: Nutrition
title: Complete vs Incomplete Proteins
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Complete vs Incomplete Proteins.

hook.text: Animal proteins have all 9 essential amino acids. Plant proteins usually don'tâ€”but it matters less than claimed.

buildup.text: Essential amino acids must come from food because your body cannot manufacture them on its own.

discovery.text: You don't need all 9 in every meal. Eating varied plants throughout the day covers them completely.

twist.text: Rice and beans form a complete protein together. Traditional cuisines solved this problem centuries ago.

climax.text: The 'incomplete protein' fear kept people eating excessive meat. Simple variety solves the problem.

punchline.text: Eat varied plants and protein completeness solves itself.

quiz.question: Do you need all essential amino acids in every meal?
options: No, variety throughout the day is enough
